root.name: setFloat()

example.code:
def setup(): table = Table()
table.addColumn("number", Table.INT) table.addColumn("mass", Table.FLOAT) table.addColumn("name", Table.STRING)
row = table.addRow() row.setInt("number", 8) row.setFloat("mass", 15.9994) row.setString("name", "Oxygen")
println(row.getInt("number")) # Prints 8 println(nf(row.getFloat("mass"), 2, 4)) # Prints 15.9994 println(row.getString("name")) # Prints "Oxygen

root.description: Stores a float value in the TableRow's specified column. The column may be specified by either its ID or title.

parameter.description: int: ID number of the target row
